block.name: committee_ga
block.docCommittee: ROGHCHOISTE AN TSEANAID UM CHOIMHDEACHT (GRINNSCRÚDÚ REACHTACH MAIDIR LEIS AN AONTAS EORPACH)

block.name: committee_en
block.docCommittee: Seanad Select Committee on Subsidiarity (European Union Legislative Scrutiny)

debateSection.name: prelude
debateSection.summary: Tháinig an Roghchoiste le chéile ag 01:00 p.m.
The Select Committee met at 01:00 p.m.

rollCall.summary: Comhaltaí a bhí i láthair / Members present:
* In éagmais / In the absence of Senator Gerard P. Craughwell.
+ In éagmais le haghaidh cuid den choiste / In the absence for part of the meeting of Senator Malcolm Noonan.

summary.person: Seanadóir / Senator Pat Casey sa Chathaoir / in the Chair.

speech.p: The first item of business is the election of the Chairperson and I now invite nominations for the position of Chairperson of the committee.
Are there any other nominations? No. I now call on Senator Pat Casey to take the Chair of the committee.

summary.i: Senator Pat Casey took the Chair.

speech.p: First, I thank members for proposing me for Chair of the committee. It is an honour to be Chairperson of this committee, which carries out the important job of scrutiny of proposed EU legislation on behalf of Seanad Éireann. I look forward to working with you all and I welcome you all, particularly those who are newly-appointed Members of Seanad Éireann.

Under Standing Order 90(3), upon first taking the Chair I must state that I do solemnly declare that I will duly and faithfully and to the best of my knowledge and ability, execute the office of the Chairperson of the Seanad Select Committee on Subsidiarity (European Union Legislative Scrutiny) without fear or favour, apply the rules as laid down by the House in an impartial and fair manner, maintain order and uphold the rights and privileges of members in accordance with the Constitution and Standing Orders.

debateSection.name: debate
debateSection.heading: Scrutiny of EU Legislative Proposals

speech.p: Members will be aware that this committee is established pursuant to Standing Order 125 as a contingency measure, pending the establishment of the committee system. The committee is established to enable Seanad Éireann to exercise its key role under the Lisbon treaty, and, in particular, to assess the subsidiarity aspects of proposed EU legislation. Members should be aware that in accordance with the procedures in committees, this proposal will be considered in private session. I now propose that the committee goes into private session for our deliberations. Is that agreed?

Just before the committee goes into private session, I want to put on the public record my deeply held conviction that the Oireachtas, and the two Houses of the Oireachtas, are not fulfilling their function in relation to subsidiarity issues or examinations. I also want to put on the public record my view that the sectoral committees, the formation of which at the moment is now delayed, are not performing that function adequately and have never really, in all of my experience, carried out that function. I have spoken to the Cathaoirleach of the Seanad and I believe that the Seanad should make efforts to carry out this function seriously by itself alongside the procedures which were established under the last Seanad to vet statutory instruments in draft form before they are implemented. I wanted to put that on the record before we go into private session.
I appreciate that Senator. Do other members have any other comments before we go into private session? No. Is that agreed? Agreed.

debateSection.summary: The select committee went into private session at 1.06 p.m. and adjourned at 1.12 p.m. sine die.
